item.title: CML/CDW/CDF/CDE private deployments are failing in EU Control Plane region.
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Investigation of New Deployment Failures in EU Control Plane Region Summary: There are issues with new deployments of private CML/CDW/CDF/CDE experiences in the EU Control Plane region. Existing workloads are expected to be working as normal, and the current investigation is ongoing. Further updates are expected by the end of the business day.

Feb 26, 17:50 UTC
Investigating - Current Status:
Existing workloads should be working as expected. Only new deployments of private CML/CDW/CDF/CDE experiences are failing in EU Control Plane region.

This is currently being investigated, we expect to have further updates towards the End of Business today.

item.title: https://archive.cloudera.com/ is temporarily unavailable.
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Investigating Status Update Summary: The company is currently investigating an issue with its https://archive.cloudera.com/, impacting customers trying to pull workload artifacts and upgrades. An update is expected within the hour. Incident began at 12:30 AM UTC. [Medium] - Resolved Status Update Summary: The company has confirmed that the implemented solution has addressed the issue. Customers are advised to raise a support case if they continue to experience problems. A root cause analysis will be published within seven business days.

Feb 22, 03:51 UTC
Resolved - Current Status: Our teams have confirmed that the solution implemented has addressed the issue. If you continue to experience issues please raise a support case with us.

A root cause analysis (RCA) will be published within seven business days.

Feb 22, 03:35 UTC
Investigating - Current Status: We are currently investigating a https://archive.cloudera.com/ where in Customers who are trying to pull workload artifacts like CDH, CFM and CM would be impacted and also all workload upgrades are impacted. We will have an update within 60 mins.
Incident Start time: 12:30 AM UTC February, 2024.

item.title: FreeIPA clusters are in an unreachable state
item.content:encoded:
[High] - FreeIPA Service Unreachable

Summary: Customers may observe FreeIPA service in an unreachable status. The issue was identified at approximately 10:53 UTC on February 14th, 2024. A solution has been implemented but is still under monitoring.

Feb 14, 17:50 UTC
Resolved - Current Status: Our teams have confirmation that the solution implemented has addressed the issue. If you continue to experience issues please raise a support case with us.

A root cause analysis (RCA) will be published within seven business days.

Customer Experience: Customers may observe FreeIPA service in an unreachable status.

Incident Start time: ~10:53 UTC Feburary 14th, 2024

Feb 14, 16:54 UTC
Monitoring - Current Status: Our teams have identified the source of the issue and have implemented a solution which is under monitoring.
We will have another update within 60 mins.
Customer Experience: Customer may observe FreeIPA service in an unreachable status.
Incident Start time: ~10:53 UTC Feburary 14th, 2024

Feb 14, 16:26 UTC
Identified - Current Status: Our teams have identified the source of the issue.
We are working on developing and implementing a solution to restore the service(s).
We will have another update within 60 mins.

Customer Experience: Customer may observe FreeIPA service in an unreachable status.

Incident Start time: ~10:53 UTC Feburary 14th, 2024

Feb 14, 16:19 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Feb 14, 16:05 UTC
Investigating - Current Status: We are currently investigating a potential issue with the FreeIPA service.
Customer Experience: Customer may observe FreeIPA service in an unreachable status.

item.title: FreeIPA clusters went into unreachable state momentarily.
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - FreeIPA Unreachable State

Summary: FreeIPA experienced intermittent unreachable states, impacting administrative operations. The system has been stabilized, and the root cause is under investigation.

Feb 14, 11:00 UTC
Resolved - We received reports of FreeIPA going into unreachable state for a few of our customers.On investigating we found that the issue was intermittent. This impacted administrative operations for the workload. For now we have worked around the issue and the system has been stable.
The teams are investigating the issue further to determine the root cause.

item.title: Degraded connectivity issues between Control plane and workload clusters
item.content:encoded:
Jan 31, 10:00 UTC
Resolved - We observed degraded connectivity issues between control plane and workload for a subset of customers.
This impacted operations like orchestration, auto-scaling and administration of workloads from control plane.
The incident has been resolved now and no action is needed from customers.
A root cause analysis (RCA) will be published within seven business days.

item.title: Clusters on the US Control Plane in an unreachable state
item.content:encoded:
Nov 10, 22:06 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 10, 22:04 UTC
Update - Current Status: Our teams have successfully deployed a fix for the issue and confirmed that the issue has been resolved. If you are still experiencing issues or have any questions please raise a support case with us. A root cause analysis (RCA) will be published within 7 Business days.

Customer Experience: Customers on the US control plan may observe DataLake & DataHub cluster displaying an unreachable state

Incident Start time: ~20:00 UTC November 10th, 2023
Incident End time: ~21:40 UTC November 10th, 2023

Nov 10, 21:13 UTC
Investigating - Current Status: We are currently investigating an issue with our US Control Plane.
We will have another update within 60 mins.
Customer Experience: Customers on the US control plan may observe DataLake & DataHub cluster displaying an unreachable state
Incident Start time: ~20:00 UTC November 10th, 2023

item.content:encoded:

A root cause analysis (RCA) will be published within seven business days.

Incident Start Time: 09:40 AM UTC November 3rd, 2023
Incident End Time: 11:00 AM UTC November 3rd, 2023

Nov 3, 10:32 UTC

Nov 3, 10:28 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating a potential issue with EU Control Plane down(workload logins/UI are not working). We will have an update within 60 mins.
Customer Experience: Customers may observe issues while logging in to the atlas URL, Ranger URL, and resource manager URL are not accessible.

item.title: cdp login not useable against EU and AP control planes
item.content:encoded:
Nov 3, 07:50 UTC
Resolved - The cdp cli login was not working in EU and AP. It was remediated at about 11:40am PST Mon Nov 6

item.title: Control Plane Issues
item.content:encoded:
Oct 5, 23:07 UTC
Resolved - The fix implemented has seen positive results, resolving connectivity issues.

Oct 5, 22:34 UTC
Update - The overall control plane has stabilized. We're investigating connectivity issues that are impacting some number of customers. A potential fix is being implemented to resolve the connectivity issues.

Oct 5, 21:26 UTC
Monitoring - We've implemented a fix to our control plane service. We're seeing services recover albeit with higher latency.

Oct 5, 20:49 UTC
Identified - Issues have been identified in an internal control plane service. Multiple services are currently impacted.

Oct 5, 19:27 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating problems affecting the US control plane.

item.title: CDP Public Cloud Control Plane (EU-1) will be under maintenance
item.content:encoded:
Aug 8, 05:01 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Aug 8, 03:01 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Aug 4, 15:18 UTC
Scheduled - Control Plane Internet ingress maintenance will involve temporary re-routing of Control Plane traffic through a replacement internet-ingress for the duration of the maintenance. Temporary routing will result in different IP addresses being used for access to the Control Plane for the duration of the maintenance window.The temporary IP addresses are within the existing IP range (3.65.246.128/27) published in the public documentation. Customers who have constructed their firewall rulesets in accordance with the documentation will be unaffected by the maintenance

Interfaces affected :
Web console access https://console.eu-1.cdp.cloudera.com
API and `cdp` CLI calls https://api.eu-1.cdp.cloudera.com

Customer Action/Impact :
Customers who have constructed their firewall rulesets in accordance with the documentation will be unaffected; no action required.
Any customer that has firewall policies locking the above two hostnames to the 3 current IP addresses (rather than the documented block of 32 IP addresses) will be affected for the duration of the maintenance window.
These customers and their CDP environments will not be able to access the CDP Control Plane during that window. This will likely affect automation from the CDP API/CLI and/or auto-scaling of Data Hub Clusters.
We recommend that firewall policies are reviewed and updated to match documented requirements.

For more information, contact https://support.cloudera.com.

item.title: Possible failures with workloads in AWS us-east-1.
item.content:encoded:
Jun 13, 22:49 UTC
Resolved - AWS confirms that the issues in us-east-1 are resolved. For full details, refer to https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status.

Jun 13, 20:50 UTC
Monitoring - AWS is having issues with multiple services in us-east-1. CDP components are not affected, however customer workloads may be affected. Follow https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status for updates. Amazon is seeing services recover at this point.

item.title: CDP landing page is not working. SSO continues to work.
item.content:encoded:
May 31, 12:45 UTC
Resolved - CDP landing page is working now. The issue has been resolved.

May 31, 12:33 UTC
Monitoring - Fix deployed. Service is currently being monitored.

May 31, 10:25 UTC
Update - Note: https://console.cdp.cloudera.com/#/ is working as expected and customers can continue to use it.

May 31, 10:08 UTC
Identified - Issue identified and a fix is in progress.

May 31, 08:35 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating a potential issue with CDP landing page https://cdp.cloudera.com. Customers accessing this page directly would not be to access the CDP Management Console. Customers using SSO continue to work without any disruption. In case you are affected please reach out to Cloudera Support for further assistance.

Note: https://console.cdp.cloudera.com/#/ is working as expected and customers can continue to use it

item.title: Urgent maintenance impacting CML, CDF, CDE
item.content:encoded:
May 22, 21:01 UTC
Completed - Completed with no interruption of the service in question.

May 22, 20:45 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

May 22, 20:29 UTC
Scheduled - A short maintenance is required for a supporting service. There will be a very short outage which will impact the following products: CML, CDF, CDE. During this outage, modifications to existing Kubernetes clusters will fail. This includes the creation of new clusters as well as the modification, upgrade, or removal of existing clusters.

May 3, 13:25 UTC
Identified - Issue identified.

May 3, 12:57 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

May 3, 12:57 UTC
Investigating - Due to new image published by AKS, CDW virtual warehouses running on Azure might be impacted. Currently the issue is being investigated.

item.title: Potential downtime to CML experience
item.content:encoded:
Feb 6, 11:49 UTC
Resolved - CML service is back up and operating as expected in all the regions.

Feb 6, 11:12 UTC
Investigating - We are undergoing an Emergency update with CML experience in all the regions. Though we do not anticipate any outages, there could be issues pertaining to accessing the CML control plane web UI and API calls.

item.title: Workload orchestration for Azure impacted due to Azure networking Outage
item.content:encoded:
Jan 25, 02:00 UTC
Resolved - Orchestration of CDP workload clusters on Azure was impaired due to Azure networking outage. This would have resulted in errors during the creation of Environment, Datalake, and Datahub. Also, the existing workloads might have experienced a loss of connectivity. Please do note control plane operations were not impacted due to this. For the underlying root cause please refer to: https://azure.status.microsoft/en-us/status/history/.

item.title: Intermittent issues with the US Control plane.
item.content:encoded:
Jan 18, 16:40 UTC
Resolved - All services are back up and operating as expected.

Jan 18, 15:18 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 18, 15:12 UTC
Update - Issue seems to be partially resolved.

Jan 18, 15:10 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 18, 14:00 UTC
Investigating - SRE team is currently investigating an issue with us-west control plane. This impacts all the management operations including ability to launch clusters, modify users etc. However please do note customer workloads are not impacted due to this

item.title: Intermittent availability issues with Cloudera Data Warehouse service [CDW]
item.content:encoded:
Jan 18, 03:00 UTC
Resolved - The CDW service had intermittent availability issues due to which operations like orchestration and administration were impacted for Data Warehouse clusters. This incident lasted for an hour. The team is actively investigating and fixing the root cause. Sorry for the inconvenience caused.

item.title: CDP Control Plane: Maintenance: Dec 10th - 3 hours
item.content:encoded:
Dec 10, 18:01 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed in all regions.

Dec 10, 17:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Nov 29, 17:49 UTC
Scheduled - A planned maintenance is coming, starting 2022-12-10 17:00:00 PM UTC, through 2022-12-10 20:00:00 PM UTC. During this maintenance window, interactive workloads, API and CLI based integration and automation and DataHub autoscaling may be affected.

item.title: We are investigating issues with the Data Warehouse web UI
item.content:encoded:
Nov 22, 03:46 UTC
Resolved - The issue has been resolved after resolving issues in an application load balancer.

Nov 22, 03:13 UTC
Investigating - We are investigating issues with the "Data Warehouse" web UI. The API does not appear to be impacted.
